title: mev-boost crash on startup on Windows x64 ?
body:
I am trying to run mev-boost on my staking machine on Win64 with go1.19 windows/amd64

I was able to pull the packagein from GitHub  compile the go package using 
`go install github.com/flashbots/mev-boost@latest`
I am using the[ TDM-GCC compiler ](https://jmeubank.github.io/tdm-gcc/articles/2021-05/10.3.0-release)

When I try to start mev-boost I got the following error below.
When running in docker from the latest docker image, I get a similar error.

Question : any recommendation or setup to run mev-boost on windows?


C:\Users\Nicolas>mev-boost -help
Exception 0xc000001d 0x0 0x0 0x7ff7b60849ee

What may help is using the portable build.

Please try either cloning the repo and building with `make build-portable`, or use one of the portable Docker images: https://hub.docker.com/r/flashbots/mev-boost/tags

Thanks Chris, 
The docker portable build worked. Yeah! I am unblocked.

However the portable-build compilation failled.
The following commands in windows shell :
```
set CGO_CFLAGS=-"O -D__BLST_PORTABLE__"
go install github.com/flashbots/mev-boost@latest
```
fails on windows with the following error :

```
# runtime/cgo
gcc: error: unrecognized command-line option '-"O'; did you mean '-O'?
```
I am documenting this in case we want to get a comprehensive doc for solo stakers on Windows ;) - Diversity matters.

there was a bug in the Readme / Makefile regarding `CGO_FLAGS`: the dash has to be inside the quotes, like this:

`set CGO_CFLAGS="-O -D__BLST_PORTABLE__"`

Updated the README in this PR: https://github.com/flashbots/mev-boost/pull/288

thanks for the report 🙏
